content:
• Friday, July 29, 2011
  • PWER

    Power-One (NASDAQ:PWER), a maker of power subsystems for IT gear and solar panels, rose 4.8%...

    Power-One (NASDAQ:PWER), a maker of power subsystems for IT gear and solar panels, rose 4.8% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $260.3M (+21% Y/Y) and $0.21, compared with a consensus of $253.9M and $0.22. While Q3 revenue guidance is below consensus, full-year guidance is in-line, pleasing a market worried about solar industry weakness.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • ARBA

    Business commerce software provider Ariba (NASDAQ:ARBA) rose 4.5% after reporting Q2 results...

    Business commerce software provider Ariba (NASDAQ:ARBA) rose 4.5% after reporting Q2 results yesterday. The market appears pleased with the company's strong subscription software (+74% Y/Y) and e-commerce network (+249% Y/Y) revenue growth, and with its Q4 revenue guidance of $118M-$120M (above a $116.8M consensus). (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • GOL

    Brazilian airline Gol Linhas (GOL -22.2%) makes a hard landing after stating in a filing it...

    Brazilian airline Gol Linhas (GOL -22.2%) makes a hard landing after stating in a filing it expects 2011 EBIT growth of 1-4%, compared with a prior forecast of 6.5-20%. The company blames the lower forecast on higher fuel and co-pilot training costs. However, Gol is also slightly reducing its revenue guidance for the year.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • VOD

    While Vodafone (VOD +4.6%) is seen as the big winner in Verizon Wireless' decision to pay a $10B...

    While Vodafone (VOD +4.6%) is seen as the big winner in Verizon Wireless' decision to pay a $10B dividend, Verizon (VZ -1%) proper will benefit as well. With Verizon's wireline division generating little cash as its local phone business steadily declines, it needs its share of the payoff to keep paying its quarterly dividend to shareholders.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • ABAX

    Medical products company Abaxis (NASDAQ:ABAX) finishes the day in the red, dropping -14.5% after...

    Medical products company Abaxis (NASDAQ:ABAX) finishes the day in the red, dropping -14.5% after reporting FQ1 earnings that missed expectations. International bookings took a hit due to timing issues with orders through its distributors. CEO Clint Severson summed up the quarter as "a period of investment for future growth."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • MSCC

    Microsemi (NASDAQ:MSCC) recorded a 3.3% gain after reporting FQ3 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of...

    Microsemi (NASDAQ:MSCC) recorded a 3.3% gain after reporting FQ3 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $216.7M (+59% Y/Y, boosted by the Actel acquisition) and $0.49, beating a consensus of $216.1M and $0.48. Microsemi expects FQ4 EPS of $0.52-$0.54, above a $0.52 consensus, as it continues to pursue its hostile bid for Zarlink (OTC:ZLKKF)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • TRLG

    High-end jeans retailer True Religion (TRLG +12%) holds on to gains late in the day after...

    High-end jeans retailer True Religion (TRLG +12%) holds on to gains late in the day after reporting Q2 earnings beat expectations. The company posted sales gains across virtually all units, with international sales up 31%, and its U.S. consumer-direct segment jumping over 42%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • RMBS

    Memory technology firm Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS) is down 3.2% after an appeals court refuses to...

    Memory technology firm Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS) is down 3.2% after an appeals court refuses to reconsider a ruling finding the company guilty of destroying documents relevant to a lawsuit against DRAM manufacturers Micron (NASDAQ:MU) and Hynix (OTC:HXSCF). However, analyst Mike Crawford doesn't think the ruling will affect the conflict's resolution.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • QLGC

    QLogic (QLGC -4.4%) remains weak after reporting its FQ1 results late yesterday. The current...

    QLogic (QLGC -4.4%) remains weak after reporting its FQ1 results late yesterday. The current quarter topped estimates, but follow-on guidance for Q2 was weak. Baird cuts the stock to neutral on concerns over H2, including worries about a dip in demand in front of the refresh of Intel's Romley platform.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • AMCC

    Applied Micro Circuits (AMCC -21%) continues to tank after reporting late Thursday FQ1 sales...

    Applied Micro Circuits (AMCC -21%) continues to tank after reporting late Thursday FQ1 sales were in line, but its bottom line missed due to higher operating expenses. Gross margins were also hurt by an unfavorable low-end growth product mix, which may have carryover effects into the next quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • GOOG

    Wells Fargo's Jennifer Fritzsche sees Motorola's (MMI -2%) weak 2H guidance as reason to...

    Wells Fargo's Jennifer Fritzsche sees Motorola's (MMI -2%) weak 2H guidance as reason to downgrade its shares to Neutral. While Fritzsche thinks Motorola "held its own" in Q2, and is positive on the arrival of the 4G Bionic and Photon, she believes the company's hopes for a full-year mobile division profit might be too optimistic. (results) (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • NTRI

    Weight loss program provider Nutrisystem (NASDAQ:NTRI) gains 7.4% after reporting Q2 revenue and...

    Weight loss program provider Nutrisystem (NASDAQ:NTRI) gains 7.4% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $116.1M (-18% Y/Y) and $0.38, compared with a consensus of $118.3M and $0.29. The company is increasing its 2011 EPS guidance to $0.65-$0.70, above a consensus of $0.60. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • RNWK

    RealNetworks (RNWK -2.6%) is lower today after reporting a wider-than-expected Q2 loss late...

    RealNetworks (RNWK -2.6%) is lower today after reporting a wider-than-expected Q2 loss late yesterday. The company reafirms Q3 guidance, and, as part of its strategic review, announces a $1.00 per share special dividend and 1-for-4 reverse stock split.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • DRIV-OLD

    E-commerce solutions provider Digital River (DRIV-OLD -16.4%) falls hard after reporting Q2...

    E-commerce solutions provider Digital River (DRIV-OLD -16.4%) falls hard after reporting Q2 results. Revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $92.5M (+13% Y/Y) and $0.17 beat a consensus of $92.3M and $0.15, but 2011 guidance of $393M in revenue and $1.12 in non-GAAP EPS falls short of a consensus of $406.2M at $1.14. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • NTGR

    Netgear (NTGR -9.8%) trades lower after beating Q2 expectations, but most of the gains came from...

    Netgear (NTGR -9.8%) trades lower after beating Q2 expectations, but most of the gains came from a one-time $10M customer order. The networking-product provider also lowers its revenue forecast third-quarter over back-to-school demand concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • JAZZ

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ) clocks a 14.7% gain after reporting Q2 revenue and adjusted...

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ) clocks a 14.7% gain after reporting Q2 revenue and adjusted EPS of $64.6M (+60%) and $0.82, beating a consensus of $61.9M and $0.77. Sales of its flagship Xyrem drug for treating cataplexy rose 67% Y/Y. The company now expects 2011 adjusted EPS of $3.15-$3.25, ahead of a $3.07 consensus. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • ROK

    Shares of Rockwell (ROK -2%) are down after SocGen cut it to sell earlier today on valuation,...

    Shares of Rockwell (ROK -2%) are down after SocGen cut it to sell earlier today on valuation, saying despite the recent 25% decline in price, valuations are still too "robust."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • CELL

    Mobile logistics provider Brightpoint (CELL +13.9%) surges after riding strong smartphone and...

    Mobile logistics provider Brightpoint (CELL +13.9%) surges after riding strong smartphone and tablet demand to Q2 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $1.2B (+57% Y/Y) and $0.23, beating a consensus of $1.1B and $0.20. The company expects 2011 non-GAAP EPS of $0.95-$1.05, compared with a $0.96 consensus. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • AON

    More on Aon (NYSE:AON): following an intitial pop in premarket trading on its Q2 earnings...

    More on Aon (NYSE:AON): following an intitial pop in premarket trading on its Q2 earnings report, shares have slumped. The stock is trading -2.2% after the insurance company issued a cautious outlook for H2, saying "macro conditions remain challenging globally."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • EXPE

    Consumer spending may be weak, but people are still traveling, at least based on Expedia's (EXPE...

    Consumer spending may be weak, but people are still traveling, at least based on Expedia's (EXPE +12.2%) strong Q2 showing: profits +23% Y/Y, domestic bookings +10%, international bookings +45%. Analysts at Citigroup, Jefferies and UBS raise price targets on the shares. Priceline (PCLN +2.9%) also trading higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • IM

    IT products distributor Ingram Micro (NYSE:IM) is up 9.4% after delivering strong Q2 results....

    IT products distributor Ingram Micro (NYSE:IM) is up 9.4% after delivering strong Q2 results. The company expects sequential growth that's in line with seasonality, a forecast that could calm investors worried about sagging IT demand and high channel inventory following Juniper's (NYSE:JNPR) results and a weak forecast from rival Arrow (NYSE:ARW). (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • GNW

    Genworth (GNW +5.2%) is taking steps to prepare for a possible split of its mortgage insurance...

    Genworth (GNW +5.2%) is taking steps to prepare for a possible split of its mortgage insurance operations from its life insurance and wealth management businesses, and is accelerating plans to buy back shares, CEO Michael Fraizer says. Looks like a win for Steve Eisman, who has blasted the company for a “massive destruction of shareholder value.”

     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • CPSI

    Computer Programs and Systems (CPSI +16.4%) ramps higher after announcing its Q2 earnings report...

    Computer Programs and Systems (CPSI +16.4%) ramps higher after announcing its Q2 earnings report yesterday after the close. Sales jumped 28% to $48.8 million, easily beating estimates. The company also reaffirmed guidance, which had been a source of concern for some analysts leading up to the earnings report.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO -2.3%) shares reverse sharp early gains as Street analysts are unimpressed with the...

    Yahoo (YHOO -2.3%) shares reverse sharp early gains as Street analysts are unimpressed with the company's plan to monetize the Alipay payment system. Citigroup's Mark Mahaney says "Yahoo appears to have become a forced seller of one of its key Asian assets."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • MXWL

    Maxwell Technologies (MXWL +17%) jumps after Q2 numbers beat estimates on a 30% surge in...

    Maxwell Technologies (MXWL +17%) jumps after Q2 numbers beat estimates on a 30% surge in revenue. Results were driven by a 54% increase in its ultracapacitor sales for wind turbines and hybrid electric vehicle drive systems.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • RSYS

    Radisys (RSYS +14%) trades higher after posting a better-than-expected Q2 as revenue from its...

    Radisys (RSYS +14%) trades higher after posting a better-than-expected Q2 as revenue from its next-generation communications networks rose 12.5%. The company expects next generation revenue to be a core contributor going forward, growing from 40% of total revenue in the second quarter to more than two-thirds by 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • STMP

    Stamps.com (NASDAQ:STMP) posts an 18.9% gain after reporting Q2 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of...

    Stamps.com (NASDAQ:STMP) posts an 18.9% gain after reporting Q2 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $26.6M (+26% Y/Y) and $0.45, trouncing a consensus of $22.1M and $0.23. The company is respectively lifting its 2011 revenue and non-GAAP EPS forecasts to $90M-$100M and $1.10-$1.30, compared with a consensus of $90.8M and $0.95. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • ZOLL

    Zoll Medical (ZOLL +25%) soars after FQ3 earnings easily blows out estimates. Revenues jumped...

    Zoll Medical (ZOLL +25%) soars after FQ3 earnings easily blows out estimates. Revenues jumped 22% Y/Y, driven by higher defibrillator sales after larger hospitals - who have been sitting on the sidelines for the past couple of years - are stepping up purchases.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • LPNT

    Hospital operator LifePoint (NASDAQ:LPNT) is up 6.7% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of...

    Hospital operator LifePoint (NASDAQ:LPNT) is up 6.7% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $877.6M (+11% Y/Y) and $0.77, slightly beating a consensus of $877.4M and $0.75. The company is lifting its 2011 EPS guidance to $2.95-$3.15, from a prior range of $2.80-$3.10. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • TEF

    NetQin Mobile (NQ +6%) signs a framework agreement with Telefonica (TEF +1.2%) to provide mobile...

    NetQin Mobile (NQ +6%) signs a framework agreement with Telefonica (TEF +1.2%) to provide mobile Internet services to the company's subscribers. Under the agreement, NetQin's mobile internet services will be integrated in Telefonica's App Store and mobile devices.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • RGC

    Movie theater chain Regal Entertainment (NYSE:RGC) is up 9.7% after reporting consensus-beating...

    Movie theater chain Regal Entertainment (NYSE:RGC) is up 9.7% after reporting consensus-beating Q2 earnings . Q2 free cash flow stood at $130M, which the company says is its second-highest total in four years. During Regal's earnings CC, the company reported that Q3 is "off to a strong start," with industry box office revenue up about 4-5% Y/Y. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • ANTM

    Medicaid-dependent insurers are hit after a warning from Amerigroup (AGP -18.4%) says the state...

    Medicaid-dependent insurers are hit after a warning from Amerigroup (AGP -18.4%) says the state of Georgia made a sweeping review of its Medicaid records and discovered a number of duplicate payments, which resulted in a $0.16/share charge in Q2. The state is now seeking reimbursement from insurers. WCG -10.6%, CVH -4.8%, CNC -4.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 2 Comments
  • AB

    AllianceBernstein (NYSE:AB) falls 2.7% after announcing Q2 revenue and adjusted EPS of $728M...

    AllianceBernstein (NYSE:AB) falls 2.7% after announcing Q2 revenue and adjusted EPS of $728M (-4% Y/Y) and $0.35, below a consensus of $749.2M and $0.40. Assets under management fell by $19.5B Q/Q to $461B. $51.3M worth of stock Holding Units were repurchased during the quarter. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • SIMO

    Silicon Motion (SIMO +9.8%) pops after beating Q2 estimates on reduced operating expenses and...

    Silicon Motion (SIMO +9.8%) pops after beating Q2 estimates on reduced operating expenses and posting the second-highest revenue quarter in the company's history. OEM business increased by 40% sequentially to about 50% of mobile storage sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • STEC

    With shares down 39.5% following weak Q2 results and disappointing guidance, and the company...

    With shares down 39.5% following weak Q2 results and disappointing guidance, and the company also facing an SEC investigation and ongoing customer concentration issues, Gleacher & Co. asks if it's time to take STEC private. Another option could be for STEC to be sold to STX or WDC, who could use the firm to bolster their solid-state drive businesses.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • BHC

    ISTA Pharmaceuticals (ISTA) falls 27.6% after reporting Q2 revenue and adjusted EPS of $37.1M...

    ISTA Pharmaceuticals (ISTA) falls 27.6% after reporting Q2 revenue and adjusted EPS of $37.1M (+6% Y/Y) and -$0.11, below a consensus ofÂ  $41.9M and $0.05. Perhaps more importantly, ISTA is also reporting that a a Phase 3 study for its REMURA drug for treating dry eye disease showed that the drug "was not statistically significantly better" than a placebo.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • ANTM

    More on Amerigroup (AGP -19.7%): trades lower after missing Q2 estimates due to a retroactive...

    More on Amerigroup (AGP -19.7%): trades lower after missing Q2 estimates due to a retroactive premium adjustment in Georgia. The company also lowers guidance, saying it anticipates the of rate renewals "to be more modest than previously expected," and higher medical cost trends are pressuring margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • TNAV

    TeleNav (NASDAQ:TNAV), a provider of location-based services (LBS) for mobile devices,...

    TeleNav (NASDAQ:TNAV), a provider of location-based services (LBS) for mobile devices, is down 39.3%. While FQ4 numbers beat consensus, the company's FY12 guidance for revenue of $215M-$225M and non-GAAP EPS of $0.58-$0.68 is below a consensus of $237.6M and $0.88. Competition from Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) and other LBS providers appears to be taking its toll. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • N

    Cloud business software developer NetSuite (NYSE:N) rises 5.4% after reporting Q2 revenue and...

    Cloud business software developer NetSuite (NYSE:N) rises 5.4% after reporting Q2 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $57.8M (+23% Y/Y) and $0.02, compared with a consensus of $55.9M and $0.02. Calculated billings (revenue + deferred revenue) rose 30% Y/Y to $62.6M, and operating cash flow rose 88% to $8.4M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • ACOM

    Shares of Ancestry.com (ACOM -11.8%) plummet after the company left its subscriber outlook for...

    Shares of Ancestry.com (ACOM -11.8%) plummet after the company left its subscriber outlook for the full year unchanged at 1.71M-1.73M. The online family history information provider beat forecasts with Q2 EPS of $0.33 on revenue of $101M, a 35% increase Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • SIFY

    More on Sify Technologies (SIFY +14.8%): recently hit by questions over its accounting, the...

    More on Sify Technologies (SIFY +14.8%): recently hit by questions over its accounting, the company reports its FQ1 and beats estimates across-the-board. Net losses were $1.91M, a significant improvement from year ago losses of $4.05M, while revenues were up 31% Y/Y, driven by 40% growth in its enterprise services business.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • CTCT

    ConstantContact (NASDAQ:CTCT) is down 27.8% after reporting Q2 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of...

    ConstantContact (NASDAQ:CTCT) is down 27.8% after reporting Q2 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $52.5M (+24% Y/Y) and $0.15, compared with a consensus of $52.9M and $0.11. The company expects Q3 revenue and EPS of $54.2M-$54.7M and $0.21-$0.23, below a consensus of $55.8M and $0.26. Rival MKTG is down 3.5% in sympathy.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM
  • VEOEY

    ADRs of French waste and water utility Veolia (VE) -7.9% premarket after its lower full-year...

    ADRs of French waste and water utility Veolia (VE) -7.9% premarket after its lower full-year guidance announcement is linked to an accounting fraud at the group’s U.S. waste activities as well as the underperformance of its Dalkia unit in Italy.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • ICO

    More on Arch Coal: Q2 profit tanks as expenses related its purchase of International Coal...

    More on Arch Coal: Q2 profit tanks as expenses related its purchase of International Coal (NYSE:ICO) offset slight revenue gains driven by higher pricing. The company reduces FY guidance due to Q3 impairments to its Powder River Basin facility due to flooding and rail disruptions. Shares -5.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • CMPR

    Vistaprint (VPRT -37%) is getting shellacked after projecting full-year 2012 EPS of just...

    Vistaprint (VPRT -37%) is getting shellacked after projecting full-year 2012 EPS of just $1.10-1.20 vs. $2.64 consensus - which it attributed on yesterday's call to the need to invest in "a new financial approach." VPRT, which provides online self-service printing, competes with EK, HPQ, SFLY, and Flickr (YHOO).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM
  • NXPI

    NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ:NXPI) is down 11.3% premarket after reporting Q2 revenue and non-GAAP...

    NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ:NXPI) is down 11.3% premarket after reporting Q2 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $1.12B (flat Y/Y) and $0.51 - the latter falls short of a $0.52 consensus. The company expects Q3 EPS of $0.47-$0.56, compared with a $0.55 consensus. Revenue growth is expected to be in a range of -5% to +1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM
  • SIFY

    Sify (NASDAQ:SIFY): FQ1 net loss of $1.91M. Revenue of $50.73M (+31% Y/Y) beats by $12M. Shares...

    Sify (NASDAQ:SIFY): FQ1 net loss of $1.91M. Revenue of $50.73M (+31% Y/Y) beats by $12M. Shares +15.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • AHCI

    U.K. homecare provider Allied HealthCare International (NASDAQ:AHCI) +56% after agreeing to be...

    U.K. homecare provider Allied HealthCare International (NASDAQ:AHCI) +56% after agreeing to be acquired by Saga Group for $3.90/share ($175M), a 59% premium. (PR) The deal validates a prescient call by Andrew August back in March.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • RLD

    RealD (NYSE:RLD): despite a 9% jump in FQ1 profits on stronger license revenue and solid gross...

    RealD (NYSE:RLD): despite a 9% jump in FQ1 profits on stronger license revenue and solid gross margins, sales came in at just $59.6 million, significantly below estimates for $78.8 million. Shares -15.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • AHCI

    Premarket gainers: AHCI +56%. SIFY +15%. EVEP-OLD +10%. FCEL +6%. YHOO +4%. VOD +4%. AXL +4%....

    Premarket gainers: AHCI +56%. SIFY +15%. EVEP-OLD +10%. FCEL +6%. YHOO +4%. VOD +4%. AXL +4%. CHK +3%.
    Losers: VPRT -37%. STEC -36%. MILL -20%. AGP -16%. CTCT -16%. NXPI -11%. MMI -6%. IRE -6%. LVLT -3%. S -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM

  • The 10 year note yield falls further following the GDP news, now at its YTD low of 2.87%.

    The 10 year note yield falls further following the GDP news, now at its YTD low of 2.87%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM | 2 Comments
  • CERN

    Health care information-technology company Cerner's (NASDAQ:CERN) Q2 profit leapt 30% on...

    Health care information-technology company Cerner's (NASDAQ:CERN) Q2 profit leapt 30% on double-digit sales gains and a surge in operating cash flows. The company ups its H2 forecast on strong current bookings. Shares +3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • MET

    More on MetLife (NYSE:MET): Q2 earnings fell 21% on an increase in claims and unexpectedly high...

    More on MetLife (NYSE:MET): Q2 earnings fell 21% on an increase in claims and unexpectedly high derivatives losses, but core profits rose. Revenue jumped 33% to $16.89 billion, with operating income coming in at $1.24 a share vs. $1.13 expected. Shares +2.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • AMGN

    Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN): Q2 EPS of $1.37 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $3.96B (+4.1% Y/Y) beats by...

    Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN): Q2 EPS of $1.37 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $3.96B (+4.1% Y/Y) beats by $180M. Sees FY'11 EPS at upper end of $5.00-5.20; Revenue at upper end of $15.1-15.5B. Shares +2.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM
  • PPC

    Pilgrim's Pride (NYSE:PPC): Q2 EPS of -$0.60 misses by $0.39. Revenue of $1.92B (+22% Y/Y) beats...

    Pilgrim's Pride (NYSE:PPC): Q2 EPS of -$0.60 misses by $0.39. Revenue of $1.92B (+22% Y/Y) beats by $110M. Shares -5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM
  • EVEP-OLD

    EV Energy Partners (NASDAQ:EVEP-OLD), which owns or controls 230K acres in the Utica Shale, is...

    EV Energy Partners (NASDAQ:EVEP-OLD), which owns or controls 230K acres in the Utica Shale, is +16% premarket following Chesapeake's (CHK +0.7%) unveiling of "a major new liquids-rich discovery." Oppenheimer, while conceding it's "late to the game," boosts EVEP to Outperform, saying "significant upside" remains. Jeff Saut nailed this one.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM
  • NEM

    More on Newmont Mining's (NYSE:NEM) Q2: Newmont saw a Q2 average realized gold price of...

    More on Newmont Mining's (NYSE:NEM) Q2: Newmont saw a Q2 average realized gold price of $1,501/oz. The company is maintaining its 2011 targets for production, costs applicable to sales (CAS), and capex. Its quarterly dividend will be rising to $0.30/share in Q3, from $0.20/share in Q2. NEM -1.7% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • ARCH

    Arch Coal (NYSE:ACI): Q2 EPS of $0.44 misses by $0.16. Revenue of $985.1M (+29% Y/Y) beats by...

    Arch Coal (NYSE:ACI): Q2 EPS of $0.44 misses by $0.16. Revenue of $985.1M (+29% Y/Y) beats by $30M. Sees FY'11 EPS of $1.75-2.15. Shares -4.9% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO) jumps 4% after reaching an agreement on Alipay "in which Alibaba Group (OTC:ALBCF)...

    Yahoo (YHOO) jumps 4% after reaching an agreement on Alipay "in which Alibaba Group (OTC:ALBCF) will continue to participate in Alipay's future financial performance, including a future IPO or other liquidity event." Alibaba, 40% owned by Yahoo, would receive $2-6B from an IPO of Alipay or other exit. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 AM | 1 Comment
